events.originalText: a magnitude 7.1 earthquake hit Anchorage, Alaska (pictured) and caused over 100 injuries.
events.subtitle: 2018 Anchorage earthquake
events.headline: Magnitude 7.1 Earthquake Hits Anchorage, Alaska, Causing Over 100 Injuries

events.originalText: John Sentamu was enthroned as Archbishop of York, becoming the first black archbishop in the Church of England.
events.subtitle: John Sentamu
events.headline: John Sentamu Enthroned as First Black Archbishop of York

events.originalText: Marconi Electronic Systems and British Aerospace merged to form BAE Systems, one of the world's largest defence companies.
events.subtitle: Marconi Electronic Systems
events.headline: Marconi Electronic Systems and British Aerospace Merge to Form BAE Systems

events.originalText: A series of protests by anti-globalization activists against the World Trade Organization Ministerial Conference of 1999 in Seattle forced the cancellation of the opening ceremonies.
events.subtitle: 1999 Seattle WTO protests
events.headline: Protests Force Cancellation of WTO Ministerial Conference Opening Ceremonies in Seattle

events.originalText: The Wall, a rock opera and concept album by the English band Pink Floyd, was first released.
events.subtitle: The Wall
events.headline: Pink Floyd's 'The Wall' Rock Opera and Concept Album Released

events.originalText: A meteorite crashed through a roof in Sylacauga, Alabama, and hit a sleeping woman in the first verified case of a human being injured by an extraterrestrial object.
events.subtitle: Sylacauga (meteorite)
events.headline: Meteorite Crashes Through Roof in Sylacauga, Alabama, Injuring Sleeping Woman

events.originalText: Mutesa II, Kabaka of Buganda, was temporarily deposed and exiled to London by Andrew Cohen, the British governor of Uganda.
events.subtitle: Mutesa II of Buganda
events.headline: Mutesa II, Kabaka of Buganda, Temporarily Deposed and Exiled to London

events.originalText: After the United Nations voted to adopt a partition plan for Palestine, a civil war broke out between the region's Jewish and Arab communities.
events.subtitle: United Nations Partition Plan for Palestine
events.headline: Civil War Breaks Out in Palestine After UN Adopts Partition Plan

events.originalText: World War II: Japanese warships defeated the U.S. Navy in a nighttime naval battle off Tassafaronga, Guadalcanal.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Japanese Warships Defeat U.S. Navy in Naval Battle off Tassafaronga, Guadalcanal

events.originalText: English mathematician Alan Turing published the first details of the Turing machine (model pictured), an abstract device that can simulate the logic of any computer algorithm by manipulating symbols.
events.subtitle: Alan Turing
events.headline: Alan Turing Publishes Details of Turing Machine, Abstract Device for Computer Algorithms

events.originalText: Flying Scotsman became the first steam locomotive officially to exceed 100 miles per hour (161 km/h).
events.subtitle: LNER Class A3 4472 Flying Scotsman
events.headline: Flying Scotsman First Steam Locomotive to Exceed 100 MPH Officially

events.originalText: The first international football match (pictured) took place at Hamilton Crescent, Glasgow, between Scotland and England.
events.subtitle: 1872 Scotland v England football match
events.headline: First International Football Match Takes Place in Glasgow Between Scotland and England

events.originalText: Russian warships led by Pavel Nakhimov destroyed an Ottoman fleet of frigates at the Battle of Sinop, prompting France and the United Kingdom to enter the Crimean War.
events.subtitle: Pavel Nakhimov
events.headline: Russian Warships Destroy Ottoman Fleet at Battle of Sinop, Leading to Crimean War

events.originalText: An expedition led by Francisco Javier de Balmis departed A Coruña, Spain, with the aim of vaccinating millions in South America and Asia against smallpox.
events.subtitle: Balmis Expedition
events.headline: Francisco Javier de Balmis Leads Expedition to Vaccinate Against Smallpox in South America and Asia

events.originalText: Great Northern War: Swedish forces led by King Charles XII defeated the Russian army at the Battle of Narva.
events.subtitle: Great Northern War
events.headline: Swedish Forces Defeat Russian Army at Battle of Narva in Great Northern War
